assertions.title: convey the name of the text input
assertions.rationale: A screen reader user needs to know what to enter.
examples: A screen reader will announce the name (label).
Voice control software will let the user say something like "click <name>" to activate the control.

assertions.title: convey the text input role
assertions.rationale: A screen reader user needs to know that they can enter text.
examples: A screen reader might be announce the role as "text input", "edit", "edit text", etc.
Voice control software will let the user say something like "click text box" to focus a the input.

assertions.title: convey the value of the text input
assertions.rationale: A screen reader user needs to know the current value of the input.

assertions.title: convey changes to the value
assertions.rationale: The user needs to know that the value was successfully changed.
examples: When the user enter tests, the screen reader will announce it back to them.

assertions.title: provide shortcuts to jump to text inputs
assertions.rationale: Screen reader users might want to quickly navigate to different text inputs on the page.
